p: Among other studies, acai showed antiparasitic activity against L. infantum and L. amazonensis without cytotoxic effects to the host cell [ 18], reduction of early carcinogenesis in the colon of mice, mitigation of DNA damage induced by azoxymethane [ 19], antitumorigenic potential in the MCF-7 cell line [ 20], reduction in selected markers of metabolic disease risk in overweight adults [ 21], protection against renal damage in diabetic rats [ 22], inhibition of urinary bladder carcinogenesis in mice [ 23], improvement of cardiac dysfunction and exercise intolerance in rats subjected to myocardial infarction [ 24], and prevention of oxidative damage in the brain of rats [ 25].
